lexUnit.name: anger.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to provoke a feeling of great annoyance

sentence.text: A PEDESTRIANISATION scheme which has angered disabled groups in Darlington is to come into force from March 29 .
It angered her that he appeared to think this amounted to a great concession .
It angered her that anyone 's work should be treated cavalierly because someone with a little authority regarded a newsroom as a draughts board .
It angers me that an insurance company attempted to kick us in the teeth when all we were trying to do was protect ourselves . "
A PLAN to close one of Machynlleth 's two hospitals has so angered local people that town councillors are to fight the proposal .
Mr Knight , who angered colleagues when he lashed out at homosexuals by saying ` Stop sodomy " during the General Election campaign last year , said the gay issue had played a part in his decision .
But the proposed development has angered environmentalists who argue there 's no need for more housing in Swindon .
It overturns an earlier decision by a government inspector , and has angered the local MP who had opposed the building .
And Mr Hurd who 's angered the Greek Cypriots by his plans to meet the Turkish Cypriot leader , declined to comment .
` It angers me to think he is still on remand . "
Newly independent Ukraine is angering the West by its reluctance to give up nuclear weapons .
Police fired warning shots over the heads of the demonstrators to disperse them , but this angered the crowd , and several thousand people marched on Skanderbeg Square .
We were greatly angered by the arrest last month of proponents of a multi-party system .
Anti-poverty campaigners have been angered by the Chancellor 's budget decision to tax domestic fuel .

The theft , at allotments behind the Beechwood and Easterside Club , Middlesbrough , has angered the racing club members so much they are forming a vigilante group to keep overnight watch on the lofts .
The report deeply angered Price Waterhouse because it had not given evidence to Senator Kerry 's subcommittee .
